TopicTitle: Kerbin City Community Project - Phase B - New Islands

Articles.Content: How do you even instal?
I really hope KerbTown is not abandoned... I was just figuring out how to make buildings.

I really hope KerbTown is not abandoned... I was just figuring out how to make buildings.

It's not, thanks to HoneyFox, what about this Kerbin City project ?
Is there still a chance for me to get a plot?
It really depends on If the creator comes back to it, he put it on hiatus because of lack of activity a little while ago. If we can bring back the interest then it could get going again.

Hi guys, I was away from KSP for 2+ weeks, I was just informed that KerbTown was being updated. Good job =) and good to see that we could continue with the Kerbin City.

Edited April 5, 2014 by nothke
What!!!:0.0: Kerbtown is being updated!!:cool: Ohh the possibilities! Me and Deamoria can now actually work on the giant partially underground VAB and some other stuff that we needed kerbtown for.
I know it may sound ridiculous, but could someone erect a stunt park for planes? such as hoops to fly through or narrow spaces to fly through?
Can someone make the Kerbal Space Program Academy there? Kind of like the Starfleet academy from star trek (I think) like a big college campus area.

I know it may sound ridiculous, but could someone erect a stunt park for planes? such as hoops to fly through or narrow spaces to fly through?

Well, the entire city is supposed to be stunt park for planes, no? =) There already are challenges, such as doing a barrel roll between buildings or flying through a tunnel below the airport terminal. I wrote down in design guidelines that plot developers should have aerobatically challenging buildings as one of their top priorities (but still keep it real and feasible).

Can someone make the Kerbal Space Program Academy there? Kind of like the Starfleet academy from star trek (I think) like a big college campus area.

This is planned. An entire island will be dedicated to a Kerbal University campus. Scott Manley has agreed that we can use his name for the University (or one of the buildings). But there could be other things as well, one idea was to connect the university venues with youtube lectures or something like that. Any idea is welcome.

Well, the entire city is supposed to be stunt park for planes, no? =) There already are challenges, such as doing a barrel roll between buildings or flying through a tunnel below the airport terminal. I wrote down in design guidelines that plot developers should have aerobatically challenging buildings as one of their top priorities (but still keep it real and feasible).

Huh, I didn't notice that, thanks ^.^
Good to see you're back nothke, I finished my plot like a month ago and don't know what to do with it. Should I pm it to you or what?
Will this be picked up since HoneyFox fixed KerbTown for 0.23.5? Just wondering
i cant download kerbtown
Thought I might share a nice picture I got testing out my plot:
Is the Zokesia Building still there?

No, it was in an old plot I had worked on when I was less experienced. I threw it and then made this current version, however I could probably add a Zokesia sign back onto one of the buildings if you would like.
OOh, yes, i'd like that
If you want, you can send me any logo or other design you want me to use. Or should I use the photo in your signature?
signature one should do the trick
Just finished adding the sign in blender, see if I can import it into the game.
wonderful

Oh, come on. One of the largest spaceship-building corporation on Kerbin deserves that big skyscraper on the left of that picture!!! I mean, they have to do engine tests by throwing the prototype if the roof, right?

nice work JustinS222, I don't see why there would be any pb making it into the game .

@POTKC: it may be just the HQ offices, their labs and R&D building are hidden somewhere, or they use engine testing as air-conditioning/warming system in winter

How do I reserve a plot? Just so I know if I make a structure that I think fits the cityscape

Edited April 13, 2014 by One-Way Films
